com.luigisgro.cqf.job
Interface FDMJob.Configuration

All Known Implementing Classes:
PropertiesFDMJobConfiguration
Enclosing class:
FDMJob
public static interface FDMJob.Configuration

Configuration object for this job It declares all the values that must be provided to run the job

Author:
Luigi Sgro

getDerivativeDirection

Option.Direction getDerivativeDirection()
Returns:
The direction of the derivative to be priced: "call" or "put"

Returns:
The strike of the derivative to be priced

getDerivativeMaturity

java.lang.Double getDerivativeMaturity()
Returns:
The maturity in years of the derivative to be priced

getDerivativeType

java.lang.Object getDerivativeType()
Returns:
The type of the derivative to be priced: "binary" or "vanilla"

getDerivativePosition

java.lang.Double getDerivativePosition()
Returns:
The position (positive or negative) in number of contracts of the derivative to be priced

getHedgeNumber

java.lang.Integer getHedgeNumber()
Returns:
The number of hedge instrument to insert into the strategy

getMinimumVolatility

java.lang.Double getMinimumVolatility()
Returns:
The minimum volatility of the underlying (needed only when volatility type = "uncertain")

The maximum volatility of the underlying

getUnderlyingValue

The value of the underlying used for the pricing of the derivative

getUnderlyingStep

Returns:
The step of the underlying used for the calculations

getTimeStep

java.lang.Double getTimeStep()
Returns:
The time step used for the calculations

getVolatilityType

java.lang.String getVolatilityType()
Returns:
The type of pricing to perform: "uncertain" for uncertain volatility, "constant" for constant volatility

getHedgePosition

java.lang.Double getHedgePosition(int i)
Returns:
The position (positive or negative) of the i-th hedge instrument

getHedgeType

java.lang.String getHedgeType(int i)
Returns:
The type of the i-th hedge instrument: "binary" or "vanilla"

getHedgePriceType

java.lang.Object getHedgePriceType(int i)
Returns:
"automatic" if the price should be calulated automatically from Black-Scholes, "fixed" otherwise

getHedgePrice

java.lang.Double getHedgePrice(int i)
Returns:
The price of the i-th hedge instrument (not needed if hedge price type is "automatic")
